Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brett M
Reviews.Content: I was at the Whitney Wyndham for a vacation. When we first checked in, we were greeted by Becky. She was friendly, cheerful, and extremely informative. She acted as a great front desk person (helping connect to the internet, getting us a mini-fridge), but also as a voluntary concierge, providing us with great Ideas about where to go, tours we might like, contemporary restaurants, good spots for music (the focus of our trip), and even a little bit of historical info about architecture. We ended up having to stay extra nights due to Hurricane Isaac and all of the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable & safe. There was even a complimentary breakfast & dinner on those days. All in all, Becky and all of the staff made us fall in love with New Orleans and with the Whitney Wyndham Hotel. We cannot wait to go back and visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A1”
Reviews.Author: nathan p
Reviews.Content: was at the whitney in august during hurricane issac and i havto to say out of all the several hotels ive stayed at this was by far the best. the staff such as martina,justin,becky, patrick the manager,ella in housekeeping,leonard and any others i may have forgotten were fantastic. the service,courtesy,kindness and friendlyness were amazing. wenever im new orleans next its the whitney all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: WP J
Reviews.Content: On August 18, 2012 we booked rooms (party of 8) for overnight stay. We were checked in by Patrick Kerwin, Manager and we left in search of a meal (because the advertised restaurant in hotel was closed down). On return, two of our rooms had visible bed bugs, when reported to front desk was offered other rooms. We checked out one of the rooms prior to moving our luggage in and there were stained bed linens. Asked to speak w/manager and was told he was only available by phone, while speaking with Patrick over the phone he stated he was now in another state and there was nothing that could be done and we could not prove bed bugs even though showed his staff, took pictures, brought a dead one to front desk. I would NOT recommend this hotel or the STAFF, would never stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Malise_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed during hurricane Isaac (my first hurricane) and the staff - especially Casey, the General Manager - were SUPERB! I feel sad now that I had to leave. They are like my new family on the other side of the world...I will be coming back to this hotel EVERY time I am in New Orleans. Kind, generous, thoughtful and hospitable staff make a great hotel AMAZING. Thank you Whitney! Malise Martin

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingTipstet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and enjoyed many things about the hotel especially the great location as we were able to walk to the French Quarter. The front desk staff were excellent and very helpful. Very nice atmosphere in an old historic bank. On the flip side we were not happy with the housekeeping in our room. The first night we had stained and ripped sheets, although clean it was time to throw this set out. We put the card on our bed saying we would like them changed the next night. We got back late the next night and to our surprise we found the maid had put a small size fitted sheet on our queen bed so two corners did not even fit on the bed so we had to get the front desk to get us a sheet to fit at 11 pm. We changed the bed ourselves and then the next day the maid took away our top sheet. We even tipped a maid to get us an extra pillow and she never brought us one. There were also items on the floor that were never picked up when we got in the room (used kleenex, stir stick etc). Plus each day the disposable cups and coffee was not replaced daily. We stay at a lot of hotels and this is the first I have wrote a review on the housekeeping. A hotel like the Wyndham should have a higher standard. We ate once at the restaurant, the food was tasty but lukewarm at best. The lettuce was not washed well as there were big pieces of dirt stuck to the lettuce. Internet was available but difficult to get, it only really worked in their front salon. Enjoyed the jug of lemon water they always had available at the tour desk. Overall we liked the hotel but felt they need to up their cleaning syandards in the room and replace items that are getting worn and chipped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Trip!”
Reviews.Author: teresafilkins
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Accomodations were great, staff made you feel welcome and they were so very helpful! Walking distance to many eating establishments and Canal Street. The meeting room was great, quite and functionable. I will stay at the Whitney Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: I travel on business 3 or 4 times a month. The Whitney is now at the top of my list. The staff is great. The rooms are comfortable. Location is convenient. Have already referred this hotel to my freinds and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “A very very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bull46
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for several days. I really enjoyed every minute of my stay. The hotel was previously an old bank building that still have the old vault that is used as a private dinning area. The rooms are very nice and the restaurant is very nice. The staff treat you like royalty from the time you arrive until the time you leave. The hotel is conveniently located so you pretty much walk every where you need to go. Canal and Bourbon Streets are only blocks away. Price is very reasonable. A very remarkable hotel that i will definetly be visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Travel B
Reviews.Content: Made a second trip back to the Whitney and it was great again!!!! Staff was warm and friendly, very informative, Room was great had a very spacious king room this times with a couple steps down into the main area, really neat feature!!! Can't wait to to get back again in a few weeks!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler03_12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here for a spring break getaway and were delighted with a gorgeous room with a bay window--quite romantic! The staff was courteous and the hostess was kind enough to give us a spoon (after joking with my boyfriend) when we returned late one night with delicious ice cream-- and no way to eat it! The hotel is just a quick walk to the French Quarter, so you get the same experience without the same price tag, plus you burn some Cajun food calories on the walk back. The price was good, the room was great, and it was exactly what we needed for New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “How to start a weekend right in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen T
Reviews.Content: We all know that there are tons of things to do in New Orleans. However the most important thing for me is where to lay my head at night. For myself it was the Wyndham-Whitney Historic Hotel on Poydras. From the moment you entered the building you begin to see the previous history of it as a large and opulent bank. From the huge safe door that is displayed proudly in the open position so that you can see the inner working of the door and locks to the check in area which was once a tellers area. This Hotel is a great slice of history. It has that cozy and warm feel of the past that has been updated and made into a very nice place to stay. If you are looking for a jacuzzi tub, modern brash paint schemes etc, this may not be the place for you. However if you want a place that in itself is a destination and makes you feel comfortable from as soon as you walk in then stay at the Wyndham Whitney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: BeBeof2
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful historic property. The location is close to the Riverwalk, Harrah's Casino and just across the street from a well known local resturant called Mothers. The ONLY negative was not having a small fridge in our room. Overall a great choice and would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here.”
Reviews.Author: kimberlymetcalf
Reviews.Content: Recently visited this hotel and found it to be outdated, run down, dirty and the rooms smelled horribly. The staff didn't seem to care about our concerns. No one to help us with luggage, left our car parked covering the sidewalk for over an hour and we seemed to be putting the front desk out when we checked in. If at all possible, stay someplace else. Lots of really nice hotels in NOLA, this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “The good could not outweigh the bad”
Reviews.Author: DealLover
Reviews.Content: It seems that "historic" means a very small, cramped room and no amenities. The only good thing I can think of is maybe the location. This hotel is about 3 blocks from Canal Street and maybe 4 blocks from Bourbon Street and Harrah's casino. Of course there are hotels everywhere in that area, so it's not like this hotel has a lock on location. The bad started at checkin which was painfully slow with one of the clerks being downright surly. Four of us were staying in one room, but initially were given only two keys. After requesting 2 more keys we started a 3 day game of who's key doesn't work today. We actually had to get all 4 keys reprogrammed twice. Coming in late Saturday night (okay very early Sunday morning) the key didn't work. Went to front desk. No one there but another guest that had been waiting 45 minutes. A call from my phone to the hotel woke up the clerk sleeping in the back. They should really put a bell or buzzer at the desk. Next issue, every morning between 9:00 and 9:30 housekeeping knocked on the door. Seriously...who gets up that early in New Orleans over the weekend? I didn't particularly like hearing "We leave at 11:30" through the door. I felt like my relaxing weekend was being dictated by housekeeping staff. On no day were enough towels left by housekeeping. The first day we got 2 face cloths and 3 bath towels and the next no face cloths at all. The two double bed room was cramped. Barely accomodating the two beds, the chest that doubled as a TV stand and closet, a desk and 1 (ONE) chair. There was no actual closet. The only way to hang clothes was to take the ironing board out of the chest, but then there was nowhere to put the ironing board. It was a weekend of stepping over and on suitcases. The bathroom was a good size, but the door stuck so that it didn't close fully and made a loud annoying sound when being tugged (and I mean tugged hard) to open. The bathroom door really needed to be closed because it opened right into the sleeping area...well the whole room was the sleeping area. I believe the door stuck because there was absolutely no ventilation in the bathroom. That's the "historic" part again I guess. Our room was at the back of the hotel I guess because the building backs up to another building. That meant that our one small (historic) frosted window let in zero light. No we didn't actually spend a lot of time in the room, but the little time we did spend there was pretty stressful. The best thing about the hotel is the restaurant. The breakfast was the most reasonable we found in the area. The service was excellent and the food great. Frankly I'm pretty sure there are better choices in the area and I'll definitely find another hotel to try for my next visit. Whitney was a disappointment in every way imaginable.

Reviews.Title: “Old historic land mark”
Reviews.Author: Abraham R
Reviews.Content: This hotel if full of story. Well located and good food. Hotel is located in the midle of big new buildings, look very nice having this old historic building surounded by new ones. The employees are very nice and the area very secure. During our stay we visit the festival at just one block from the hotel. Very nice music and food also. Definitely I will stay again at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: zzupschuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Whitney the 1st week of May for 5 nights. You can read the other reviews for a better description of the hotel. It is a great place to stay! I want to commend management for helping me out...I originally reserved a room with 1 bed, and then 2 weeks later found out I needed 2 beds, but the hotel was showing no availability. I emailed the manager and he let me know he would keep an eye on my reservation and change it if something opened up. When I arrived at The Whitney to check in I found out I had been upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with a king bed and a queen sofa bed. Unbelievable customer service...Thanks So much!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Critter0429
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very clean and the staff very nice. I loved the fact that they kept the original look of the bank and incorporated it into the hotel. The rooms, although not huge, were very nice and the bathroom was spacious and clean. I got an excellent deal with their internet special and their parking fee is average for most hotels in the area. Room service for breakfast was well worth the money. It was more than we could eat. I would recommend this place to anyone to try out. We love New Orleans and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience.”
Reviews.Author: Kumarkrishnan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th anniversary in NOLA and stayed 3 days at the Wyndham Whitney. Beginning from our room reservation, various tours and dinner aarangements the experience was absolutely fabulous. Our reservation agent, Martina is one of the best we have encountered in our many vacations all over the world. She even had some "bubbly" waiting in our room upon our arrival along with a special card. We were upgraded to a suite which had a great view of the city. Besides Martina, the other staff who helped us were Michael and Becky. They made some great suggestions on local restaurants (which were all fabulous), sites and good tours. Managers Patrick and Michele were simply the best. The room was spacious and clean. The breakfasts in the hotel was delicioos. I can go on and on. Overall, I highly recommend the Wydham Whitney. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Historic Hotel Excellent location Good in Value”
Reviews.Author: Wendysoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely Historic hotel in April 11 - April 13/2012 for 3 nights before our cruise. Our room was in mid size nice & very clean room with 2 double beds very comfortable; 2 nights tables with alarm clock; a desk with chair plus one extra single chair. Our room is facing at the back so is very quiet but no view. Bathroom was big and well equipped. The location is excellent, just few blocks away from French Quarter and Harrah's Casino. Our 1st night we ate our dinner at buffet Harrah's; very good buffet & good value; after dinner we walk back to the hotel around 8:30pm. Poydras Street is very safe street; streets surround the hotel is very upscale not like French Quarter. We ate 2 times full breakfast & one time dinner in their restaurant, good quality tasty breakfast in good price & dinner was good too. If you need to do banking this hotel is a bank; the entrance is in the front of street. This hote is a very lovely Historic hotel with friendly services; hotel had offered me clean room, comfortable beds, excellent location and most important is their price is very reasonable & affordable. 100% plus will come back & recommend to anyone want "Historic" hotel with clean & comfortable bed in excellent location with reasonable & affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “N_Joyed It”
Reviews.Author: Ricky B
Reviews.Content: My family was in town for the weekend to attend a class reunion, and I must say i had a very nice and comfortable stay ay the Whitney. We are from New Orleans and visit often and this hotel is definitley on top of my list. The housekeeping team was very nic, and understanding of how long it takes my wife to get ready as they tried to do their job. Overall it was fun real nice staff and room. See you next time. The Bickham Family

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Delicioux
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the The Whitney Wyndham Historic Hotel in May of this year, having made the reservations via bookings.com. I was unfamiliar with New Orleans and the reasons I booked the Whitney, besides location, was that (a)Parking was advertised as free on-site and (b) both my companion & I has some work to attend to, and free wi-fi was included. Unfortunately both these facilities were not available When I arrived at the Whitney, my reservation had not been received. I was asked to wait, and wait I did. I sat in the lobby for 50mins, being updated after 35mins to be told that the fax had been received. Then when I asked about parking I was told there was a fee. The receptionist would not uphold my booking.com invoice, which clearly states that there was free parking. She told me parking was premium in New Orleans - which I was aware of and was the reason I paid that bit extra for the Whitney as I though we were getting parking included. My contract was with booking.com, I felt that the hotel should have honoured that booking and the facilities that they had (falsely) advertised - I see this has been changed on the booking.com website since. This error did not lie with me, yet it was I who had to pay the additional $66 for parking across the street. There is free-WIFI in the hotel..... but not if you have Apple products! My Iphone & Mac would not connect. I asked the female receptionist about this and she said that my security settings were set too high. When I checked, my settings seemed fine. I could not amend the problem. Later that evening, I approached a male receptionist about this and he told me that the hotel has ALWAYS had that problem, that they had spent $16,000 on the system and no-one knows why it is not compatible with Apple. I was furious. I had spent over an hour of my afternoon trying & fix it. If she had been honest with me initially, I would not have minded as much. There is a PC just off the lobby but the software is so archaic. I could not access my documents, gmail was in HTML, hotmail would not open as no ActiveX. I ended up having to go down town to an internet cafe, spending $20 for 24h access. All in all, the hotel is very nice. Good location, nice rooms. However, the problems I encountered just tarnished my stay. I probably would recommend the hotel if you are travelling to New Orleans but I myself left feeling disappointed and mislead.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans is back and fantastic again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hughlois
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay in New Orleans at the Whitney Hotel far exceeded our expectations. From check in to check out, we were treated like family by all of the staff. Any request was met with instant response and courteous treatment by all. Without a doubt will, when possible, stay at the Whitney again. Excellent in all areas. We, though, slightly handicapped (age and unable to walk long distances easily), found that we were near enough to all venues to enable us to enjoy ourselves with not strain. Had a ball!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Noble A
Reviews.Content: Very informative and hospitable staff (must be a southern thing) Great location next to the casino and bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “All You Could Ask For”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip, I discovered that I had to have surgery and could not return home for it but had to be in New Orleans instead. I had stayed at the Whitney Wyhdam many times in the past. I called them and explained the situation; they could NOT have been nicer. I went straight from the hospital to the hotel. My room was ready; the key was waiting at the front desk; my check-in had been handled by the manager. Fresh ice, bottled water, and soft drinks were waiting in my room. Every member of the staff offered to help me in any way he / she could â€“ I felt totally secure and totally taken care of. My stay lasted several days and their concern and offers of assistance lasted also. I COULD NOT HAVE ASKED FOR MORE. Would I return? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, NO breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LAbeachbum1
Reviews.Content: About a 10 minute walk to Canal Street and the border of the French Quarter, it's in the business district but not too close to the drunken tourists. Not many restaurants near unless you go to the FQ. Staff was friendly and accomodating (I requested a fridge at booking and was given one, and they took phone messages). There wasn't much light in the room, as the curtains didn't open fully. And suprisingly, breakfast is NOT included - you can pay to eat at the restaurant downstairs. For such a hotel and the cost, I would have expected a complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Bowling trip”
Reviews.Author: Camel2012
Reviews.Content: The Whitney is a great little hotel not far from Canal & Royal, placing you near the action of the French Quarter without being over it. Rooms are cozy, quiet and well maintained. The staff goes over and above to answers questions, suggest restaurants, arrange tours and make your stay totally enjoyable. I will definitely stay here on any future trips to New Orleans. NOLa is open and the food alone is worth the trip. The Whitney is a great place to sleep off the overabundance of Creole and Hurricanes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: debra36
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! The rooms were beautiful and close to everything. We liked that it only had 7 floors so that we could get to and from our room in minutes. The staff was friendly and very helpful with any questions we asked. Only drawback was parking. This hotel was a great place to stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Redaco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and just have to say how much I liked the hotel. It was clean, the staff was friendly and the location was excellant. It was a 5 min walk to the French Quarter. I liked that the hotel was a smaller hotel. The rooms were average in size, which it actually really good considering it is a historic hotel and the bathrooms were updated. The hotel was quiet and it was a weekend! Big plus in my book! There are hotels closer to the French Quarter but I imagine the price goes up. I would definitely stay there again on my own dime and time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Whitney”
Reviews.Author: Sateach53
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of boutique hotels in New Orleans over the past 6 years, we had an unexpected and pleasant stay at the Whitney. Our suite was very clean and extremely comfortable. The location of the hotel allowed us to access the French Quarter, the Garden District and the Warehouse District with ease. If we weren't walking, we used the trolley cars (stops were within a block). The best part about the Whitney is the staff. Right from the moment we were ushered into the lobby of the hotel, we were treated like family. Martina, Casey, Kevin, Lori and Kenny engaged us throughout our stay with historical tidbits, great suggestions for restaurants and transportation suggestions (some restaurants and music venues required a taxi). Although we didn't eat at the attached restaurant (Li'l Dizzy's) all who ate there raved about the food. The Whitney will be our number one choice for our next vacation to the Crescent City.

Reviews.Title: “Venerable Grand Dame Still Standing Proudly”
Reviews.Author: FinnMcCoolJC
Reviews.Content: I've spent the last few years visiting this charming old building that still delivers. I organizae a meeting that we hold here, typically during the first week of JazzFest. The rooms I have had have been roomy, clean and adequately furnished. The staff is tremendous and VERY nice. The day staff guy is decent, but always gives the impression of being very busy, even when checking you in. The late afternoon, evening woman is THE BOMB! She is gracious, remembers you and is such a joy. Sorry, but I had too much alcohol at JazzFest and forgot their names!!! LOL All in all, I will stay here again and won't tell anyone about it, so tha it remains his little gem in the Cresent City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old but very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ollerubmat
Reviews.Content: Very different then what we're use to. Just try to get a room in the front of the building. We did not expect all the big sky-scrapers around the old New Orleans charm all though out town. We would stay here again when we return to N/O, it is close enough to walk to everything you want to do. Our room was very clean and the front desk were very kind and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location ...”
Reviews.Author: V P
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, was great to walk to my hotel at night in peace and quiet after the hustle & bustle that can be the Quarter. Safe neighborhood - 3 minutes from Canal Street & the French Quarter, 5 minutes to the river and surrounded by antique shops and art galleries. Li'l Dyzzy (hotel restaurant) has an Inviting breakfast and great meat loaf on Tuesdays's lunch menu ... get there before Kenny (he has dbls). This is an historic building, it's majestic charm and elegance envelopes you as you walk in. Staff is courteous and accommodating. Spacious rooms and suites. Business or pleasure, you'll have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lifeartist59
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I spent a couple days in New Orleans on a drive from TX to Md recently. We stayed at the Whitney, and found it a great choice for us. It is a convienent walking distance to the French Quarter and riverfront. Our room was spacious, well furnished, comfortable and very clean. All the staff were friendly and quite helpful. We had a wonderful stay and would choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Return to New Orleans for First Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: gillibt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the location is wonderful. Close enough to walk to your favorite hot spots, new experiences, and in a great location not to be kept up by the late night spirit of New Orleans. Don't feel like walking? There is a trolley just a corner away from the hotel to get you to the Garden District or to the French Quarter. The staff was helpful and always had a smile. Comfortable rooms and great view.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay yet in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Vict0ria_H648
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Whitney Wyndham Hotel last month and have nothing but good things to say about it! From the moment I was greeted at the front door, I was made to feel at home and comfortable. Staff members went out of their way to be hospitable and helpful. My room was comfortable and quiet with lovely appointments. I truly felt that I was at home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “tired”
Reviews.Author: willypete
Reviews.Content: I noticed a reviewer who said that he stayed for $116/night. If we had paid that instead of $240, I might feel different. The rooms were not large at all, (at least the one we stayed in) and there were stairs to navigate in the room. This created excitement when getting up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom-almost took a header on the way back to bed. I think that this is the only time in my life I've stayed in a hotel room with this "feature". There was only one wobbly lamp on one bedside table, the wardrobe door was broken and would not stay closed, so another obstacle had to be dealt with in the night, and there was no lamp on the desk. No micro, no fridge, no wireless, even though we were on the second floor. For $240, (plus $40/night parking) I think one could expect a lot more-as a matter of fact, we stayed in a hotel in Arlington two nights later for the Rangers game, and the rent was much less than half, and it was much larger with all the above mentioned amenities, free parking and a free breakfast. On the positive side, the staff was very friendly and helpful. This place is way too impressed with itself, and running on fumes.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay. A few rough edges, but a decent value.”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews are overblown. We didn't have any major problems. We booked well in advance and stayed here for about half the cost ($116 a night) of our swankier official convention hotel. If we had only stayed two or three nights, I would have given it 4 stars, but I did keep noticing little things that brought down my overall opinion. The room was clean and comfortable. Bed was great. Fine mattress, nice bedding. Shower had plenty of hot water. Lots of granite, brass and crown molding to give the feel of an upscale place. No closet, but a spacious enough armoire. Room and bathroom weren't enormous, but both a little bigger than average. Had a nice desk, though no table when there was plenty of room for one. Ancient, smallish TV, I'd guess a 19 incher with a relatively limited channel selection, but we weren't there to watch TV. Can't beat the location, maybe a quarter to a third of a mile away from the French Quarter, Convention Center and the Superdome all. Staff were all pleasant enough. 6th floor ice machine was broken the whole stay. Cashier wouldn't break a bill for me so I could tip the housekeeper. They lost my check-in paperwork and I had to come back down and fill it out again. Our view was a fine enough city view, but I would have hated to have been on the other side of the building, which has a monstrous newer building six feet outside the window. No view from that side but a concrete wall. Old AC unit in our room gradually stopped working. Ice had accumulated inside it, blocking the flow. We endured one hot night to get it back working right. Housekeepers were mostly fine, but they never got there before midafternoon. No pool. Didn't use the restaurant or check to see if there's an exercise room. It was fine enough. We saved a lot of spending money to use while we were in town. I wouldn't seek this place out on a future stay, but I'd be fine staying there if it looked like the best value again.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and much much more!”
Reviews.Author: Judyannnick
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Whitney Hotel. I found the experience to be a very pleasant one. The hotel staff were very personable. I really like staying in smaller hotels when the Hotel manager and staff recognize you by name. Very, very nice... The rooms were clean and spacious and I thought the location being a couple blocks from the Quarter was a big plus.. I would recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich n
Reviews.Content: Great value in comparison to others in the area. Older hotel but clean. Patrick the manager is great for local knowledge vs the normal tourist traps. Kevin, the door man, also a good asset. Close to French Quarter and Super Dome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!! Classic, Cozy & Clean.”
Reviews.Author: goinintl407
Reviews.Content: I almost don't want to share my secret but as reviews are valuable to me, I will return the favor. The people are wonderful & so helpful. I was traveling solo this trip & felt totally safe and at home. The hospitality was wonderful. The room was perfect. Small but comfortable. Nice authentic details like beautiful wood armoire. Spacious bathroom with Bath & Body Works toiletries. Great historical building but clean. Cool restaurant on 1st floor that served breakfast til 2pm with omelette station. I walked to & around The Quarter & it was less than $5 cab ride back. If you want access to the city without the noise of The Quarter... This is it! To Martina who helped with my reservation, Laurie who charged my phone, Michael with the great suggestions of where to roam & Patrick for running a great hotel.. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: DaniseJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel received rave reviews from my fellow business colleagues who came down for a meeting. We used this hotel because we love its historic value and close proximity to the fun of New Orleans. The sales staff were a dream to work with and helped set up the meeting with us from start to finish. They even booked our meeting space across the street from them at the Pan American Life Conference Center which was extraordinarily reasonable. The special things they did for us are to great to list. I will just say that you will not be disappointed, especially with the rate!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: trinitymills
Reviews.Content: I must have passed this building a hundred times, but never realized it was a boutique hotel. Small and discreet, it still looks like a early 20th century bank building -- which it was. The architecture, tiled floors, teller booths, marble and woodwork are all still in place which gives the whole place a lovely authentic air. A branch of the Whitney bank still operates on the first level, and a handi teller is right outside the lobby. How is that for convenience? The check in and valet parking were swift and the staff were nice and efficient. Our room, a corner king suite, was enormous, quiet, beautifully appointed and a great deal at only $120 a night (other comparable hotels we usually stay at Easter weekend were considerably more during this period). There is a small restaurant on the first floor operated by a local chain, Lil' Dizzy's cafe. It was, however, always strangely empty the entire time we were there. The hotel's location is wonderful, right in the heart of the CBD and nestled right next to Poydras Center. It is a short walk to all the trendy restaurants in the CBD and also quite close to the Warehouse/Arts District and a relatively short walk to the French Quarter. The St. Charles streetcar line, which takes goes Uptown and all the way to Riverbend, is located cattycorner to the hotel. The hotel has a luxurious air, but people who like super-modern, up to date amenities might be disappointed to note that there aren't large-screen TVs in the rooms (at least there weren't in ours). One thing that did bother me was there was a set of side access doors on the ground floor right next to the guest room elevators and across from the deserted cafe that at least appeared to be well out of view of the front desk (perhaps they monitor it by hidden camera). While I enjoyed the easy access, it struck me that non-hotel guests, might also find this area extremely accessible to the guest rooms. All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: virtualcowboy
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms. Great staff. On the second floor and road noise was not bothersome, but we aren't light sleepers. Free wifi was nice to have when planning a day! I would definetly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time Killer staff!”
Reviews.Author: Travel B
Reviews.Content: On a recent quick trip to NOLA we found our new home away from home. We get to New Orleans several times a year and finally found a real gem. The staff was great, gave great service at every turn. Location was great just a couple blocks to Quarter. Can't wait to get back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Whitney Wyndham Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrswright7
Reviews.Content: Hi, my name is Betty Wright & my stay at the Whitney Wyndham Hotel was awesome. The hotel cleanliness was excellent-->the housekeeping team is wonderful! I really loves everything about this hotel. Whenever I visit New Orleans, the Whitney Wyndham is where I'll be staying :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Fqn
Reviews.Content: Stay here for three days and everything was wonderful. From the time we step into the door. The doorman, the front desk, the room attendant,and the restaurant waiters they all been very nice to us. The hotel was close the H Casino and the river walk. Thank you for everything your done for us. Francis

Reviews.Title: “Billing issues”
Reviews.Author: VisitorFromChicago
Reviews.Content: Update to earlier review. I stayed at the WW through United Airlines. I paid for the hotel ahead of time through Mileage Plus. Today I found that United Airlines did not reimburse the hotel for my stay, and instead of the hotel working it out with United or contacting me to do so, they billed my credit card which they kept on file after I checked out. This means I paid for the hotel twice. Nothing pushes my buttons more than someone reaching in my pocket to take my money without my permission. I realize that the issue with United may not have been the fault of the hotel, but trying to resolve this took no less than 5 calls to the hotel and it is still not resolved. Accounting staff seemed to be either: not in, in meetings, or gone for the day. No response to a voicemail. Finally reached a manager named Patrick this evening who seems to know what is going on. Whether or not I get my $255 back is still in question.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to New Oreleans during Mardi Gras Excellent at Whitney”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I was greatly surprised when my business trip to New Orleans occured during Mardi Gras. I booked through Windham Rewards and was quoted a rate that was extremely acceptable to my company and me. The two room suite was beautiful. The retaurant was excellent. I could watch the parade from inside my room or on the street. The staff was wonderful. I think The Whitney is an excellent hotel form family travel and business. An the bed was heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_of_Amherst
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a safe, affordable, and nice hotel near the French Quarter and I found it in the Whitney Wyndam. My room was lovely and clean. The bed was very comfortable. My only complaint is that the housekeeper did not replace the hotel-provided toiletries when they ran out. But the people at the front desk made up for that by sending more than I needed to my room when I requested replacements. The hotel, a lovely Beaux-Arts building and former bank, is located a couple of blocks from Canal St. I was in New Orleans to attend a conference on Royal St., just four or five blocks away. The location of the hotel was conveniently located near the French Quarter, the casino, and the French Market. The people at the front desk were very helpful in providing me with maps, suggestions for restaurants, and with helping me to find a shared taxi to return to the airport. I felt safe, especially as a female traveling alone, at this hotel. I would definitely stay here when traveling on business to New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “They gave away your room”
Reviews.Author: shalako2
Reviews.Content: Ibovoked my room for my nephew's wedding two months ahead. Because of plane trouble I called to delay our arrival by a day and was assured that tha would be no problem. When we arrived we were told that we were a day late and we had no room. However there computer showed that we had called and changed the arrival date. The night manager, a mr. [--], was rude, and very nasty. When I told him I would write him up, he said he would no charge! Us for the no show. Further it seemed every room in new Orleans was booked for the next to nights. Hours later and after missing a wedding party we found a room for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price, just a few blocks from central New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: maxphisher
Reviews.Content: This is simply a great hotel for a great price. It's two blocks from Canal St. and just another couple from the Bourbon, Decatur, and Royal St. bustle. The rooms are in great shape, and it is a great deal. In this price range, every other hotel looked a little frightening. Definitely save yourself some money and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SMP2
Reviews.Content: We spent March 4th thru the 8th at the Whitney Wyndham in New Orleans. Room was clean and quiet, hotel conveniently located, very helpful front desk personnel. The room was quite small but adequate for our stay. The only issue that we had was that we were unable to connect to the wifi for most of our stay. It wasn't until the last day that we were able to get connected. Other than that, I can say that we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, and Wonderful restaurant and bar ;)”
Reviews.Author: TyeG
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff, rooms were clean beds were comfy!! We walked to Harrahs, Riverwalk and BurbonSt!!! And my favorite was eating at Lil Dizzy's the hotels restaurant....the food is to DIE for!! Awesome stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “looking for a comfortable bed? look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Lesley T
Reviews.Content: We came for the New Orleans Marathon, and the description of the hotel stated pillowtop mattresses. To me, that says comfortable beds, ideal for someone about to run a marathon. Unpleasantly surprised by the uncomfortable beds! I also had no idea that I was going to be charged $40 for parking daily. Don't mind paying for the convenience, but it would have been nice to know the parking situation before arriving at 11pm. Location was excellent. We only had to step out the door to be on the marathon course. And the hotel is beautiful, staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, hospitable service”
Reviews.Author: jdebona
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks grand, and has an atmosphere of class about it. The regular price was $300 a night, but we got a group rate of $169 a night for reserving a block of rooms a few months before our trip (bachelor party). When we got there before check-in time, the very accomodating staff stored our bags for us and even gave us a room to change our clothes before heading out. The front desk was also accomodating with room keys, recommendations, and airport pick up. The restaurant in there had good food at a good price. Rooms were a little small, but the location was convenient--a short walk to Borbon Street and the French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JetBlueDriver
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from the French Qtr and the convention center. Most of the rooms are tiny, but the 2 bedroom suites are nice. The workout room is pathetic! The staff aren't the friendliest people you'll ever meet. The restaurant is fair at best. VERY LOUD if you're room is located on the front side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lord help me to go back”
Reviews.Author: freddie g
Reviews.Content: my stay at this hotels was a blessing. i never felt at home like i did at this hotel.i own 2 timeshares and one is wyndam. but this hotel treated me better than my resort. the front desk where mr. patrick and the young ladies. was so very nice and very professional and went out of their way to help me any way they could. the young lady ms hearther in the dinning area was so nice with the service she gave me. and my housekeeper that kept my room clean was in a class unbelieveable her name was Ms Marcia. she was a gift of god. her smile, her mannerism. her laugher.etc was just heart warming. if i can stay there again i want to be in room 507. i wish so many times i could do something to reward her. but that a reflection on her supervisor ms ella. but as a whole i think managnment mr. Casey A Callais. do a termendous job keeping it together. i would rate the hotel a 5 star anyday. the only problem i had is that i had to leave. but i am going to do everything in my power to get back next year. thank you . Mr Freddie Gleaves Jr, nashville. tenn.

Reviews.Title: “My family loves this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jabbg4
Reviews.Content: Every year for Mardi Gras or anytime we visit New Orleans we stay at the Whitney. The staff is friendly. The location of this hotel is wonderful, you are in walking distance to everything. We are always happy with our rooms. During our stay, we decided to stay a extra night. The wonderful manager Patrick was able to allow us to stay a extra night. We are looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice”
Reviews.Author: la_dge_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a weekend in early February (Thursday - Saturday nights). Rooms were clean, if a little rough around the edges. It wasn't too far of a walk to the French Quarter, but we didn't find many places worth visiting closer to the hotel (it would have been nice to find a good breakfast spot). Staff were courteous, but not overly friendly. I don't have any real complaints, but there's not much to rave about here either. If you're looking for a budget-friendly hotel within walking distance of the Quarter, the Wyndham Whitney is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Mardis Gras”
Reviews.Author: wheretonxt
Reviews.Content: Perfect for Mardis Gras overlooking Poydras Street. The room was cozy and had a very comfy bed with soft pillows and linens. The bathroom was a nice size and the service was excellent. It would have been nice to have a fridge to keep a cool beverage or 2 as this is New Orleans no less! We only had to walk to the corner to enjoy all the parades and we had a blast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located within a short walking distance to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, the Riverwalk, and Aquarium. I'm sitting in a very comfortable bed in room 507 typing this review. Our room overlooks Poydras Street, and we are here during Mardi Gras. The parades were a little loud last night (they were within a 100 yards of our window), but after walking around town all day everyone was tired and we slept well. The bed was firm and very comfortable. I cannot comment in the Wi-Fi. I don't use it on my computer, I tether to my cell phone. Thus no need to access the service. The staff was wonderful. We were given wristbands for access to the property, but I never felt the need to wear them. The doorman Kevin took the time to get to know us, and he recognized us whenever we returned. The front desk provided a city map and recommendations for local restaurants. I met the manager Casey Callais, and found a man very interested in the hospitality his staff and property delivers to each guest. He was not distracted while talking to me as if I were an interruption, but an engaged and genuinely interested listener. I've read negative posts about the condition of the property, and did not share the experience. The motel is in a historic building renovated into a hotel. The furnishings are antique and appropriate for the decor. We had no closet, but the room did have a large armoire perfect for our clothes hanging needs and than some. As with any antique furniture there is visible evidence the furniture has history, but none of the furniture looked like it came from a thrift store. If one looks hard enough and nit-picks, flaws can be identified at any resort this one included. However, my experience was completely positive, and I would not hesitate to return to this property. For dinner yesterday we tried Mothers a few blocks down the street, and they are a must try for their delicious po'boy sandwiches. I had their "Famous Ferdi Special (original) with ham, roast beef and debris gravy. There was a line outside the building, but it moves fast and you look at the menu while reading. We barely had time to decide on what to eat before it was time to order. Harrah's Casino was just a block or two past the restaurant. I can't comment further because we never went inside. Walking around outside in the local area I never felt we were in the "wrong neighborhood" even with my 11 year old granddaughter with us. Another restaurant for seafood lovers is Deanie's Seafood on Iberville Street in the French Quarter. I watched Adam on Man vs. Food rave about the shrimp and I have to agree the meal was awesome. My only regret, I got the appetizer size rather than the full meal. I wanted this trip to be a perfect experience for my wife and granddaughter, and this portion and hotel delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moggey
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel,was such a pleasant change from the usual cookie cutter hotels.It did not have all the usual extras....fridge,room safe......but it had character,and the bedding and furnishings were of superior quality. The staff were the best we have ever experienced,coming to our room,when the tour plans we booked with them were unavailable ,with new suggestions.Also they were most helpful with the safety deposit boxes ,for our money and passports.Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is in a quiet part of town,but within walking distance to the old town,the trolleys ($3.00 for an all day ticket) ,the casino and the river front.The internet worked all the time for us,and was very fast.A/C worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: mpsmith48
Reviews.Content: I just returned from New Orleans. We had read reviews - some negative - before we went. Our experience could not have been better. The front desk staff went above and beyond to be helpful. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great but......”
Reviews.Author: AJ G
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and as former resident of New Orleans the transformation of the old Whitney Bank building into a hotel was a stoke of genius. Great location to the Quarter and Uptown. The only problem was over a 3 day stay the internet only worked one evening. And since the hotel uses Cox as their provider there was no way to get help. Each time I told the front desk they said it would be taken care of but it never was. As I needed to connect to my office each night, this problem would make me most probably not stay there again. And this is the only reason I can only give service an average rating - if not for that it would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was excellent, clean, and quiet as others have said. And yes, the location is very good. What set this experience apart for me, was the service offered by the General Manager. While I requested 2 beds through Hotels.com, they cannot guarantee the request. The hotel happened to be totally booked for this type room during part of my week long stay. Instead of restricting me to the available rooms, the General Manager himself, Casey, took the time to go through their reservations room-by-room to find a way to accommodate my request / need for a room with 2 beds rather than a suite with a sleeper couch. I was impressed and grateful. This turned my initial disappointment into complete satisfaction. I will definitely make this hotel my first choice for my next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “BCS Bowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: terri d
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff. The king suite was very large for New Orleans standards. Well worth the money if you need the extra space. The bathroom was very spacious and room was well appointed. Make sure you sign up for "Wyndham Rewards" and you will get a treat in your room upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jwalk03
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. we got a very good rate through expedia during the Sugar Bowl. Last year for the game we stayed outside of downtown and it was very inconvenient to have to take a cab all the time. This year staying at the Whitney was aweome. Its only a few blocks walk to Bourbon St, a few blocks the other way to get to the Dome, and easily walkable to Harrah's as well. The hotel staff was very helpful as well. Promplty helped with loading and unloading the car, proving luggage racks, even getting things out of my car for me the next day just by calling down to the desk. Room was awesome. I read some of the other reviews on her saying rooms were small, all I can say is the room I stayed in was anything but! It had a bedroom and seperate seating room as well. And we didnt book a suite or anything like that. Room was supurb! The only small complaint I would have is the price for parking. $33.60 per day after tax! yikes! That said as we were walking around I looked at other downtown hotels parking prices and they were mostly in the $25-$30 range, so pretty comparable. The parking bill hurt a little, but overall it was well worth it to not have to worry about my car for 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Before.... Staying Now....Will Stay Again!!!! Thanks Cana”
Reviews.Author: Jerry L
Reviews.Content: Made reservations on HOTWIRE and a day later my daughter was able to get free of her obligations, at Boarding School. Hotwire would not make any changes by adding our daughter to the trip, regardless of extra cost! Called the lovely Cana at the Whitney Wyndham and she allowed our king bed reservation, to be converted to two queen beds at no costs! What a lady !!! I have stayed here for years and can't say enough good things, about this place!!! TRY IT...YOU'LL LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Angel45678
Reviews.Content: The Whitney is a nice hotel in a great location. The staff there is really friendly and informative. One concierge named Mark told me about all the attractions and even where to go out on a Monday night after the Saints game. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Whitney”
Reviews.Author: Stily162
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, 5-minute walk from Bourbon St and the French Quarter. Decent rooms with high ceilings. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom facilities were better than average for hotels at the same star level. We also liked the complimentary (and fast!) Internet available through both wireless and wired Ethernet cable included. Overall this hotel is a great value especially if you can get it through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: At first glance, the Whitney - Wyndham appears to be part of the historic Whitney Bank - and since it is located in part of the bank's building, that's understandable. The Wyndham has taken excellent advantage of that by incorporating the soaring ceilings, marble columns, and even the bank vault into their decor. The location was perfect - a quick walk to many fine restaurants and to Lafayette Park. (The hotel has a great little restaurant with excellent food at a very reasonable price.) The thing that made all the difference in the world, however, was the welcoming and helpful attitude of the staff. I was there for almost a week and everyone went out of their way to make me feel at home and taken care of. That goes a long way when you are traveling on business and alone in a city you don't know. The next time I come to New Orleans, I feel like I have home to return to and I will!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Trumped Any Limitations”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an historic building but, for us, the attitude of the hotel staff easily overcame any of the limitations resulting from the age of the building. In particular, receptionist Leaughan was most gracious as was the greeter who welcomes and seats customers at the hotel restaurant. Both of these young ladies obviously enjoy people. Note to Hotel Manager: give them both a raise! Although we are in our 60s, we walked to the hotel from the cruise terminal with our rolling luggage and again the next day to Union Station for our Amtrak train. Keep in mind this was in November when the weather was ideal. The location of the hotel was perfect - away from the noise of the French Quarter but within a 5 minute walk. Also, the St. Charles streetcar was one block away and the bus to Magazine Street was on the corner. Buy an all day pass for $3 and have a ball in New Orleans! Was everything perfect? No - the lighting in the small room was weak, the in room air circulator was a bit noisy and the doors of other rooms on our floor could be heard when closed. But we were not bothered too much because of the warm welcome and treatment we received from the moment we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip despite problems”
Reviews.Author: Tracey M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, our room was small with weird steps down to the main area. Our friends had gotten a larger room with no steps. The first full day we had a do not disturb sign (had to make our own) up so did not get maid service. That was fine, they left a letter. The next day we left the room about 9:30 am and stopped by the front desk to ask for maid service as soon as possible as we would be back in a couple of hours and wanted to shower. Got back about 12:30, room was not made up. Called down for towels at least. Waited a half an hour and finally went to go down to front desk but I found a maid and just got some towels from her. Found out my husband had gone down to front desk to see what was up and they said that we had refused the towels when they brought them. I was in room whole time waiting for them, no one ever knocked. Don't know if they went to wrong room or what, but sounds like not too good communication between front desk/housekeeping. Our friends had requested towels the day before and she said she got them within 5 minutes. Other than that stay was pretty good, it's in a nice area of town and pretty easy to walk anywhere we wanted to go. Probably would not stay again when there are so many other choices though

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: HappyCampersRWe
Reviews.Content: It was a leisurely walk to Bourbon and Harrahs. The hotel was clean and the bathroom was huge. I had a reservation discrepancy and was over charged for an additional day. The general manager Mr. Callais was awesome and credited us back for the day. The historical aspect of the building was pretty cool. The old vault now serves as a conference room and the teller windows are behind the check in window. The restaraunt was really good. Very reasonable prices. Was kinda worried when I saw the negative posts but the stay was one of the best we've had in New Orleans. Oh and the bed and pillows were soooo comfy. Great value, great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations for Crescent City Blues and BBQ Festival”
Reviews.Author: linzatorte
Reviews.Content: Pros: Overall, a very good stay. The beds were comfortable, rooms and hotel very clean. Shower head was very nice, the room was very quiet and there was not chatter from the service staff in the halls. The cleaning staff was over the top fantastic. Cons: The bar was not busy, but it took 10 minutes to get a beer...there was only one person working on a Saturday night, when a festival a block away! Our room keys would simply not work, period. I replace mine 4 times in one day, finally they sent someone up to check the batteries in the door. Worked like a charm. They charge 25 dollars to use their safe downstairs....I've never paid for a safe in my life. Especially if it's a general one in the office. Our last morning there, there was no water pressure, so we couldn't take showers! That took the cake. Nothing was offered to us...use another room on a lower floor, take a bit off our room charge...nothing. After spending an entire day at a festival and the evening in the Quarter, a shower sure was a needed thing Monday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Gimicky”
Reviews.Author: phk123
Reviews.Content: Wow...where to start on this hotel? I am a professional business man that travels over 50% of time so I am in and out of hotels constantly. The postive to this property is the location: You can walk to Business Center, French Quarter or Convention center. The negatives are numerous: Tired and gimicky use of space, Elevators out of site of front desk staff and accessible directly from the street with no control on whom can get into the elevator, No proper signage as to where to park when you check in, there is a space on the street but it is closed off by fencing so you are not able to park there, Unattentive and uniformed front desk staff as to where to eat simply and cheaply within walking distance or where to park for reasonable price, Room layout; I had room #713 best described as a cave, lack of proper lighting in room since majority of windows are covered over since in back of hotel, lack of properly working lock on door, horrendous water pressure, just a trickle for shower. Not a 3.5 star experience

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: mark75248
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel primarily for the location - we were attending an event at Lafayette Square, just a short block away. But the hotel is also decently located for other touristy activities, about a 5 minute walk to the edge of the French Quarter or to Harrahs and the Riverfront. Overall, I'd describe the quality as a 3.5 star, not as nice as the nearby Intercontinental, Sheraton, or Marriott, but a step above the Courtyard or Holiday Inns. The room was a bit on the small side, but clean (just a little mildew in the bath) and comfortable. The feel of the place is vintage/boutique, it's a smaller hotel located in a converted historic bank building. Internet is free if you sign up in advance for Wyndham's free "By Request" program. Unusual for New Orleans: no pool. Also unusual: there are no in-room safes. When we asked about using the safe at the front desk, we were told that would incur a $25 fee. That's exorbitant for a service that is usually free or maybe a buck or two a day at most hotels. The other negative was the attitude of the staff: not rude but somewhat indifferent. As a smaller property, there seemed to often be only one person working the desk, and they often were away from the desk area or locked in a back office. You shouldn't have to wait for 5 minutes to see a desk clerk, not midday when there's no other guests waiting. On the last morning, our water pressure dropped on our (top) floor, to the point that the shower wasn't working. Okay, that happens, especially in an older building. But when we called to inquire, they couldn't tell us when it would be resolved, didn't offer to call us when it was fixed, didn't offer to let us use a room on a lower floor with a working shower, didn't offer any compensation, and didn't even apologize. That's just poor customer service. Still, despite the shortcomings, I would stay here again, if I again got a room rate below what the bigger 4* hotels in town could offer.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool and Different”
Reviews.Author: JJ S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and will return without hesitation! Best bed I ever slept in, in a hotel!! Front desk agent was very nice. I wanted a King bed for all three nights, but there was only one available for 2 nights. She upgraded me to the King Suite to accommodate me at the SAME RATE! The hotel was built in 1890, so it's not perfect. But it is if you're a normal person who can appreciate a great deal. Lil Dizzy's Restaurant was delicious! 3 blocks from the Quarter.. two from Harrah's. Absolutely the best stay I've had in a long time and I travel a lot. Do not hesitate, STAY HERE. I'm going back next week!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: jbsunlvr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. The hotel is in the Central Business District about 5 minutes to the French Quarter or riverfront on foot. It is also conveinient to the streetcar line. Check in was quick and easy. We were given a room on the third floor. The room was a suite and though some of it was a bit dated everything was comfortable and it was the largest room we have stayed at it New Orleans. The room was clean. We could hear some street noise the first night as Poydras St has traffic all night. Lots of sirens. I noticed this the first night but either got used to it or that night was an anomoly as I would only notice it when I was awake. If you are a light sleeper ask for a higher room and one facing away from Poydras. Our flight out was late on Sunday and they kept our bags for us and had a taxi arranged to meet us at the time we came back for our bags. I would recommend this Hotel as we beleive its a great value.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tf97355
Reviews.Content: When we got there we were greeted by a wonderful staff member that immediately assigned us a room. Whenever we went to the front desk they were immediatley helpful and attended to our need immediately, from getting our room cleaned to getting extra coffee or where things were. The room was a queen sized room and and enough storage and was very nice with a great bed and wonderful bathroom and chair that was actually very comfortable to sit in. The bathroom had an excellent walk-in shower and adequate counter space. The coffee pot worked well and had very good hot coffee. Overall my wife and I enjoyed our time there and when we go back will more than likely stay there. It is near to everything such as Drago's, Mother's, Bourbon Street and the riverwalk and Aquarium. In another review I will discuss Lil Dizzy's restaurant in the hotel but sufice to say it was economical and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Grambling04
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not as it looks. The staff is very unprofessional. They Guy cooking breakfast in diner wore black cartoon printed Pajama pants with a black tshirt and black baseball cap in morning. Front desk evening staff very rude and unprofessional. Would not recommend this place to my worst enemy

Reviews.Title: “Old and musty with comfy bedding.”
Reviews.Author: trukrdude
Reviews.Content: Old, once elegant, hotel, needs a remodel. Service was great, yet limited. Sunday brunch was good, but way overpriced for buffet. Not as close to French quarter as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an overnight stay in NO. We had a great experience and definitely recommend the valet parking! The location is great if you want to visit Bourbon St. and the FQ. Mother's Restaurant was great for breakfast and just down the street. Would recommend this to family and friends and if/when we go back, would plan to stay here again. The room was bigger than we expected it to be and our room overlooking the street was quiet and offered a nice view towards the FQ.

Reviews.Title: “Mighty nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: Recently, I was in Hot Springs for a Vocational Rehabilitation Conference. My father & I had the opportunity to stay at Whitney Hotel in historic downtown New Orleans. Our room was super, the facility is well maintained & in tip top condition, the reservation process went smoothly & they helped us get the best deal possible, the valet parking was prompt, and above and beyond anything else the folks at Whitney Hotel treated us with kindness, courtesy, and professionalism!! Great place to stay!! We highly recommend the Whitney Hotel to anyone bound for the great city of New Orleans. Sincerely, Larry "Jason" Moore, MRC, CRC Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Good”
Reviews.Author: CVSHARP
Reviews.Content: Spent three days, two nights, at this charming place. For the price I paid, it was a bargain. This place used to be a bank (The Whitney, a New Orleans institution, I learned). Maybe for this reason, the rooms were very spacious. No built in closets, but wardrobes were the order of the day. The Staff was attentive and pleasant. The hotel was very clean; housekeeping left plenty of towels. The bed was very firm for my taste, but I may be an oddity. Parking was $28.00 a day (ouch!), but that's New Orleans. I could have parked across the street in a commercial lot, but the valet service was a splurge for me. My car was delivered promptly when I called for it. I did not eat at the restaurant, but that's because I was in New Orleans for a food conference and meals were provided by the conference sponsors. All in All, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in New Orleans1”
Reviews.Author: MissLewes
Reviews.Content: The Whitney Hotel is nearby all the attractions within walking distance. The room was comfortable and very tastefully furnished. We got it online at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the place”
Reviews.Author: goebel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Whitney Saturday 9/3. The bed was very comfortable. The room was spacious and well laid out. It was a great value for the price we paid. Close to the quarter but far enough away for peace and quiet. Will stay there again on the next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Melissasmith1
Reviews.Content: 38 parking per day Plus 25 for rollaway bed. The room was not ready ...the front desk was unprofessional ..I think her name is shana.....plus the restaurant food was nasty.

Reviews.Title: “"2 star price but 7 star service"”
Reviews.Author: wjy5196
Reviews.Content: I leaded a group of 52 people to New Orleans and we stayed at the Whitney Wyndham hotel. We were greeted at the door like royalty. We were escorted to a beauiful restored bank vault where we were checked in. After check-in we had an all-you-can-eat Cajun dinner at the Lil Dizzy restaurant on the first floor. I eat at lot of Cajun food before but Lil Dizzy's was the best I had. The staff was inpeccable with their service and with their southern hospitality. I am a world travler... I been to the Dubai at Burj Al Abrabl hotel (7 star hotel) and other similar hotels in Europe and Asisa and I paid a lot more and did not receive the level of service I received at the Whitney Wyndham hotel. I urge anyone who is looking for a hotel to stay in while in New Orleans they must stay at the Whitney Wynndham Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Bulldogzz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel last week and we couldn't have been happier. We loved the history of the building, and the old vault is interesting to see. Our king room wasn't huge, but it was roomy enough for the two of us. The bathroom was very big and we loved having Community Coffee in the room. Everything was exceptionally clean, and the hotel was quiet. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go from the hotel. The staff was friendly, professional and accommodating. Lil' Dizzy's Restaurant, in the lobby, serves a fantastic Sunday brunch with the best gumbo we had in NOLA. We will definitely stay at the Whitney Wyndham again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and Will be definitly be back”
Reviews.Author: Sharon_Jacobovitz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to everything. You can walk to all the tourist places and fantastic restaurants. The service at the hotel was the best I have had. I travel a lot and this hotel took care of all my needs and went above and beyond my expectations. The management is very attentive and the love of the hotel is evident with all who work there. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Allaerra
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is located in the business District of New Orleans right outside the French Quarter. The hotel is in a converted historic bank which gives a uniqueness to the venue that is very appealing. The staff was exceptional, greeting us when we arrived and responding to any and all requests. We were in town for a conference and the hotel's manager was extremely attentive to the group's needs. The rooms were clean and well-appointed, and the beds were very comfortable. It is also very conveniently located a short walk to all of NOLAs major attractions. The hotel and staff helped to make our conference a success and our stay enjoyable. We will be visiting New Orleans again soon and will definitely stay at the Whitney again.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: SimpiGon
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham was a great and interesting place to stay. I really enjoyed the mixture of history and modern flare to this hotel. I would highly recommend this to any friends and family. The staff was professional and accommodating at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: awsm66
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic hotel that has a wonderful staff that was very helpful and made sure all needs were taken care of. The hotel restaurant was great and made it easy to get a meal when you didn't want to go out. I will use this hotel for every trip back to New Orleans I make.

Reviews.Title: “The location was the best feature”
Reviews.Author: mstoymal
Reviews.Content: I will start with the good: We stayed here during the Essence Festival so location of the hotel is perfect. It's close to everything, the convention center, Canal street, Harrahs, Riverwalk, Bourbon st, the superdome was a little farther so we took a taxi...we got a really good deal on the price, booked through Southwest. The room was really clean and housekeeping did a really good job. Very comfortable bed. The bathroom is big, there were a bunch of us females in front of the mirror at the same time and there was always room. The valet/parking service was very convenient. The bad: the king room was pretty small. Our towel rack was loose and kept falling off the wall, they finally fixed it after 2 days. They apparently offer room service but there were no menus provided in the rooms , so we had no idea what was available to order. The ice machine on our floor was always out of ice, we had to go 2 floors up to get ice. Our toilet kept making a weird loud noise, scared us a couple of times LOL. Overall, it was ok and I would stay there again only if the price is right. A couple of other points, there is no microwave or mini fridge in the rooms and there is a pretty steep fee for the valet/parking service.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: joe-tricia
Reviews.Content: The employees at this beautiful hotel made the difference. The management should be happy to have such a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely,one of the worst hotels in New Orleans!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elijahdrumdog
Reviews.Content: This place is rated 3 1/2 stars......come on now!!! It is dirty to the point of actually being filthy! The windows and carpeting throughout this place was a pig sty! Bathroom was dirty and when this was pointed out to the staff....we got a "so-what" look. Bed sheets and duvet cover was dingy and the entire place,including our room and hallways smelled moldy.We went through 3 rooms and they all were the same......AWFUL!!!! The valet parking personnel were slow and unorganized.We have stayed at every major hotel in New Orleans(always booking with their web sites) and we've never had these types of problems before.Wanting to try something different and save some money,I used Priceline's "name your own price" website;Boy,did I GOOF!!! I'll be going back to the" tried and true" "booking" method that has served me well up until this fiasco!! Instead of Priceline rating this plae at 3 1/2 stars they should rate it at MINUS 3 1/2 stars!!!!!! We were in NOLA for an overnight stay and of course after this diaster we immediately checked out and checked into the Hilton/Riverside!!

Reviews.Title: “Little Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miraida1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in what used to be a bank, very interesting building. Be prepared to pay around $30.00 per day for parking. It's very cozy and the restaurant has great food also great room service.

Reviews.Title: “Old style hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: read-travel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Priceline "name your own price". Got a really good deal. It is 10 minutes walk to the busy French Quarter, and it is next to Charles Street where the cable car goes to the Garden district (tourist's favorite ride). We booked a regular room, but got a free upgrade to a suite which was big and roomy. The furniture was old, but the bed was comfortable. We will definitely stay there again, hopefully will get the same good deal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at the Whitney”
Reviews.Author: maga216
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Whitney with friends. It was our first time in New Orleans, and let me tell you - what a beautiful city. The people at the hotel were always very friendly and always very informative when we had any questions. The young man at the enterance ( sorry I don't know his name) was always willing to help with information and if he didn't know the answer, he found out. The hotel was very quite, close enough to walk to all the action, but yet quite enough to enjoy our vacation. We only ate breakfast in the resturant down stairs and it was outstanding, ( we had too much other fabulous food around town to eat :-) I would stay at the Whitney in the future and I would recommend the hotel to my friends. Thank you for making our vacation memorible. Linda

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and a great location”
Reviews.Author: bluenwhite
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Whitney Wyndham. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean but could use better lighting and ventalation in the bathroom. The hotel is an old bank and they have built a highrise office buildings around it. Unfortunately our room was on the side that butts to an office building so we had no view...but there was also no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: lexjax
Reviews.Content: we travel to New Orleans quite often and stay in the CBD at a variety of hotels...whatever is a deal at the time...we don't spend alot of time in our room as there is sooo much to see and do in this special city and we are not very picky, just happy to be there! the hotel was quiet and small/boutique style in an old bank building...a little street noise on Sunday night, but we were on the 2nd floor...the double room had an intimate feel and the bathroom was a good size given the age of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. I appreciate the manager's response to some of reviews; that is someone who cares!...we would definitely stay again! I would not recommend the restaurant in the evening...limited menu (horrible onion rings!), but it is under separate ownership from the hotel from what I understand.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Apparently Under New Improved Management”
Reviews.Author: jzirnheld
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about staying here after reading a number of bad reviews on this site but it was Jazz Fest and decided I would take a gamble since I had gotten a good price by booking way in advance. And I am really glad I did. Evidently there has been a major change in management and this hotel now works like you would expect in a Wyndham hotel. The staff were all polite, friendly, and anxious to help. Housekeeping was excellent. The hotel is renovated from its previous existence as a bank building. This leaves some interesting touches in the lobby and restaurant. It also led to an interesting room. I doubt if all rooms are the same because they had to carve them from pre-existing space, but my room was large and spacious.
